channel.title: Want more virtual memory?
channel.description:
More virtual memory
------------------------- 1. Hold down the Windows Key and press the Pause/Break button at the top right of your keyboard (another way is right-clicking your computer and clicking Properties). ------------------------- 2. Click on the Advanced tab. ------------------------- 3. Under Performance, click Settings. ------------------------- 4. Then click the Advanced tab on the button that pops up. ------------------------- 5. Under Virtual Memory at the bottom, click Change. ------------------------- 6. Click the Custom Size button. ------------------------- 7. For the initial size (depending on your HD space), type in anywhere from 1000-1500 (although i use 4000), and for the Maximum size type in anywhere from 2000-2500 (although i use 6000). ------------------------- 8. Click Set, and then exit out of all of the windows. ------------------------- 9. Finally, restart your computer. ------------------------- 10. You now have a faster computer and 1-2gb of virtual RAM!

item.title: Want more virtual memory?
item.dc:creator: @_Tiger ~Tiger~
item.description:
@_Tiger wrote:

Nice… I hope this makes my comp faster, right now it soo slow… Lemme restart.

Read full topic

item.title: Want more virtual memory?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Falko222:

You now have a faster computer and 1-2gb of virtual RAM!

Well, virtual memory does not actually speed up your computer in any way, it only allows windows to store the “rarely” used data to the hard disk in order make space in the faster physical memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Want more virtual memory?
item.dc:creator: @Falko222 Falko222
item.description:
@Falko222 wrote:

More virtual memory

  1. Hold down the Windows Key and press the Pause/Break button at the top right of your keyboard (another way is right-clicking your computer and clicking Properties).
  1. Click on the Advanced tab.
  1. Under Performance, click Settings.
  1. Then click the Advanced tab on the button that pops up.
  1. Under Virtual Memory at the bottom, click Change.
  1. Click the Custom Size button.
  1. For the initial size (depending on your HD space), type in anywhere from 1000-1500 (although i use 4000), and for the Maximum size type in anywhere from 2000-2500 (although i use 6000).
  1. Click Set, and then exit out of all of the windows.
  1. Finally, restart your computer.
  1. You now have a faster computer and 1-2gb of virtual RAM!

Read full topic
